name: Taco Bowl
description: Mexican-inspired nutritious and colorful bowl filled with seasoned ground beef, fresh vegetables, beans, and guacamole.

instructions.instruction: Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat.
Add ground beef and break apart with wooden spoon while browning.
Add cumin, paprika, garlic powder, and half the salt. Stir to combine.
Continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until beef is fully cooked.
For guacamole, mash avocados, add juice of 1 lime, remaining salt, and half the diced onion.
Keep beans and corn warm separately or heat slightly.
Place rice at bottom of serving bowls.
Add seasoned beef on top of rice.
Arrange beans, corn, lettuce, and tomatoes neatly.
Top with guacamole and sour cream.
Sprinkle with shredded cheese and remaining onion.
Serve with lime wedges on the side.

tips: Use turkey or chicken for a lighter version.
Use cauliflower rice for low-carb version.
Ingredients can be meal prepped ahead.
storageInfo: All ingredients except guacamole can be stored separately for 3 days. Consume guacamole same day.
servingSuggestion: Serve with tortilla chips and salsa.
variations: Vegetarian: Use extra black beans and mushrooms instead of meat.
